background: The Aircraft Assignment Problem involves assigning a given number of aircraft to specified routes with the goal of minimizing the total operational cost while adhering to aircraft availability limits and route demand requirements.

parameters.definition: The total number of aircraft available for assignment
The total number of routes that require aircraft assignment
The availability of each aircraft, indicating the maximum number of routes it can be assigned to
The demand for each route, indicating the number of aircraft required
The capacity matrix defining the suitability and capability of each aircraft for each route
The cost matrix representing the cost of assigning each aircraft to each route

constraint.description: Each aircraft can be assigned to at most its individual availability
Each route must have at least the required number of aircraft to meet its demand
An aircraft can be assigned to a route only if it has the capacity for that route (Capacity_{i,j} must indicate suitability)
Number of aircraft assigned to a route must be an integer
constraint.code:
# Add aircraft assignment constraints
for j in range(TotalRoutes):
    model.addConstr(gp.quicksum(AircraftAssignment[i, j] for i in range(TotalAircraft)) == Demand[j], 
                    name=f"aircraft_assignment_{j}")

constraint.description: Number of aircraft assigned to each route is non-negative
constraint.code:
# This constraint is automatically satisfied due to the binary nature of AircraftAssignment
# Binary variables are always non-negative, and their sum will always be non-negative
# No additional code is needed to enforce this constraint

constraint.description: Total number of aircraft assigned must not exceed TotalAircraft
constraint.code:
# Add constraint: Total number of aircraft assigned must not exceed TotalAircraft
model.addConstr(gp.quicksum(AircraftAssignment[i, j] for i in range(TotalAircraft) for j in range(TotalRoutes)) <= TotalAircraft, name="TotalAircraftConstraint")

constraint.description: Aircraft availability constraint: Each aircraft can be assigned to at most the number of routes specified by its availability
Route demand constraint: Each route must be assigned the required number of aircraft as specified by its demand
Capacity constraint: An aircraft can only be assigned to a route if it has the capacity to serve that route

variables.definition: Binary variable indicating whether aircraft i is assigned to route j

objective.description: Minimize the total cost of assigning aircraft to routes
objective.code:
# Set objective
model.setObjective(gp.quicksum(Costs[i, j] * AircraftAssignment[i, j] for i in range(TotalAircraft) for j in range(TotalRoutes)), gp.GRB.MINIMIZE)

code:
import json
import numpy as np
import math

import gurobipy as gp

 # Define model
model = gp.Model('model')

with open("data/complexor/AircraftAssignment/data.json", "r") as f:
    data = json.load(f)


TotalAircraft = data["TotalAircraft"] # scalar parameter
TotalRoutes = data["TotalRoutes"] # scalar parameter
Availability = np.array(data["Availability"]) # ['TotalAircraft']
Demand = np.array(data["Demand"]) # ['TotalRoutes']
Capacity = np.array(data["Capacity"]) # ['TotalAircraft', 'TotalRoutes']
Costs = np.array(data["Costs"]) # ['TotalAircraft', 'TotalRoutes']
AircraftAssignment = model.addVars(TotalAircraft, TotalRoutes, vtype=gp.GRB.BINARY, name="AircraftAssignment")

# Add aircraft assignment constraints
for i in range(TotalAircraft):
    model.addConstr(gp.quicksum(AircraftAssignment[i, j] for j in range(TotalRoutes)) <= Availability[i], name=f"aircraft_availability_{i}")

# Add constraints for meeting route demands
for j in range(TotalRoutes):
    model.addConstr(
        gp.quicksum(AircraftAssignment[i, j] for i in range(TotalAircraft)) >= Demand[j],
        name=f"route_demand_{j}"
    )

# Add aircraft capacity constraints
for i in range(TotalAircraft):
    for j in range(TotalRoutes):
        model.addConstr(AircraftAssignment[i, j] <= Capacity[i, j], name=f"capacity_constraint_{i}_{j}")

# Add aircraft assignment constraints
for j in range(TotalRoutes):
    model.addConstr(gp.quicksum(AircraftAssignment[i, j] for i in range(TotalAircraft)) == Demand[j], 
                    name=f"aircraft_assignment_{j}")

# This constraint is automatically satisfied due to the binary nature of AircraftAssignment
# Binary variables are always non-negative, and their sum will always be non-negative
# No additional code is needed to enforce this constraint

# Add constraint: Total number of aircraft assigned must not exceed TotalAircraft
model.addConstr(gp.quicksum(AircraftAssignment[i, j] for i in range(TotalAircraft) for j in range(TotalRoutes)) <= TotalAircraft, name="TotalAircraftConstraint")

# Add aircraft availability constraints
for i in range(TotalAircraft):
    model.addConstr(gp.quicksum(AircraftAssignment[i, j] for j in range(TotalRoutes)) <= Availability[i], name=f"aircraft_availability_{i}")

# Add route demand constraints
for j in range(TotalRoutes):
    model.addConstr(gp.quicksum(AircraftAssignment[i, j] for i in range(TotalAircraft)) == Demand[j], name=f"route_demand_{j}")

# Add capacity constraints
for i in range(TotalAircraft):
    for j in range(TotalRoutes):
        model.addConstr(AircraftAssignment[i, j] <= Capacity[i, j], name=f"capacity_constraint_{i}_{j}")

# Set objective
model.setObjective(gp.quicksum(Costs[i, j] * AircraftAssignment[i, j] for i in range(TotalAircraft) for j in range(TotalRoutes)), gp.GRB.MINIMIZE)

# Optimize model
model.optimize()


# Get model status
status = model.status

obj_val = None
# check whether the model is infeasible, has infinite solutions, or has an optimal solution
if status == gp.GRB.INFEASIBLE:
    obj_val = "infeasible"
elif status == gp.GRB.INF_OR_UNBD:
    obj_val = "infeasible or unbounded"
elif status == gp.GRB.UNBOUNDED:
    obj_val = "unbounded"
elif status == gp.GRB.OPTIMAL:
    obj_val = model.objVal
